title: Safe Mollusk Collection and Consumption
brief: Safely collect and prepare shellfish, snails, and other mollusks while avoiding toxic varieties.
steps: Step 1: In fresh water, look for mollusks in shallows with sandy or muddy bottoms.
Step 2: Look for narrow trails in mud or dark elliptical slits of open valves.
Step 3: Near the sea, search tidal pools and wet sand areas.
Step 4: Find shellfish clinging to rocks, reefs, and seaweed from low water mark upward.
Step 5: Locate mussel colonies in rock pools, on logs, or at base of boulders.
Step 6: Steam, boil, or bake mollusks in their shells.
Step 7: Use in stews combined with edible vegetation and tubers.
warnings: Do NOT eat shellfish that are not covered by water at high tide.
Mussels may be poisonous in tropical zones during summer months.
Always cook mollusks thoroughly - never eat them raw.
Avoid any shellfish with broken shells or foul odor.
